alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact southeastern Clayton and southwestern Grant Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Fennimore to near Bloomington to near Cassville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cassville around 450 PM CDT. Lancaster around 505 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lock And Dam 10, Big H Campground, Garber, North Buena Vista, Turkey River, County Roads X 47 And C 7 X, Beetown, Porters Bridge, Burton, and North Andover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
